replies.bodyText: I think u wanted to mean also the user store manager password pattern. Better to say as it.. "both password policies and user store manager password pattern ".
replies.author: rmsamitha

replies.bodyText: And "If the password policies are set to be in conflict of each other you may not be able to change your password" any example for such a this situation?
replies.author: rmsamitha

replies.bodyText:
And "If the password policies are set to be in conflict of each other you may not be able to change your password" any example for such a this situation?

Yes.
Example scenario 1:

password policy regex enforcing no special characters
user store manager patter enforcing to have at least some of special characters
Since no string satisfies both, validation would always fail.

Example scenario 2:

Either of the regexes enforcing the password should be length {5,7}
Min password length property is set to 8
Max password length property is set to 15
Since no string can satisfy all the length conditions, validation would always fail.

+# Change the Developer Portal Password  
+  
+  You can change your own password for the WSO2 API Manager Developer Portal using the Developer Portal UI.    
+  
+Follow the instructions below to change your password:   
+  
+1. Sign in to the Developer Portal.      
+  
+     `https://<hostname>:9443/devportal`   
+  Example: `https://localhost:9443/devportal`   
+  Use your username and password to sign in.

+  
+3. Enter your old password, a new password, re-enter the new password, and thereafter click **SAVE** to submit changes.  
+  
+     [![Developer portal password change submit]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/change-devportal-password-submiting.png)]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/change-devportal-password-submiting.png)
